intro: Pleurobotryum unguiculatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pleurobotryum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are often densely packed along its stems. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in umbels, and bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forested or rocky habitats.
